intro: Turkia lasiocarpa, commonly known as the woolly turk's cap, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its hairy, silver-green foliage and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Turkia lasiocarpa is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. Its unique appearance and adaptability to arid conditions make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
